docs.lead_paragraph: I never fully appreciated myself until I lost myself.
docs.abstract: A new migraine medicine slowly drives the writer to distraction - until she comes to her own rescue.
docs.snippet: A new migraine medicine slowly drives the writer to distraction - until she comes to her own rescue.

docs.lead_paragraph: Young New Yorkers' wages have stagnated over the past 30 years, even though they are now better educated than their counterparts in 1979, according to an analysis by the Fiscal Policy Institute [pdf], a policy group that studies the economic life of New York State. Workers who were unionized, however, have fared better.

headline.main: For Young New Yorkers, Wages Stuck in 1979

docs.abstract: The wages for young New York workers have stagnated over the last 30 years, but those who are unionized have fared better, according to a new report.
docs.snippet: The wages for young New York workers have stagnated over the last 30 years, but those who are unionized have fared better, according to a new report.

docs.lead_paragraph: This week's guest blogger is Bonnie Fuller, the C.E.O. of Bonnie Fuller Media. Most recently, Fuller served as vice president and chief editorial director of American Media (Star, Shape, Men's Fitness, Natural Health and Fit Pregnancy) and was previously editor in chief of US Weekly, Glamour, Cosmopolitan, Marie Claire, YM and Flare magazines. E-mail her at info@bonniefuller.com, follow her on Twitter here and read her previous columns.

docs.lead_paragraph: Single-Payer Care Mr. McCain said: ''Senator Obama wants to set up health care bureaucracies, take over the health care of America through -- as he said, his object is a single-payer system. If you like that, you would love Canada and England.''

docs.lead_paragraph: The final presidential debate was rife with accusations and counteraccusations, claims and counterclaims, many of which were not entirely grounded in fact. Here is an examination of some of the issues raised by the candidates: Fannie and Freddie
